definition: to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
(negative prefix)/not/no
to know/knowledge/Taiwan pr. [shi4]
to record/to write a footnote
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)

sentences.english: When George told jokes at the funeral, every one thought his action was off-key.
sentences.chinese: 乔治在追悼会上说笑话，大家都认为他太不识大体了。

definition: not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
narrow-minded (idiom); petty/ungenerous
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
narrow/petty-minded
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
excessive tendency to clemency (idiom)/soft-hearted (pejorative)
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
harsh and merciless (idiom)
to be shortsighted
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
inappropriate/bad-mannered
